title: News & Media
summary: Vocabulary related to journalism, broadcasting, and the people involved in the media industry, including print and digital publications, television, radio, and common roles in news production.

sections.heading: Written Media
sections.content: Key vocabulary for describing printed and online publications.

examples.definition: Any type of mass publication printed on paper, such as newspapers and magazines.
examples.example: Print media is less popular than it was in the past.

examples.definition: A regular publication in the form of a thin book containing articles and photographs on a particular topic.
examples.example: I read it in a science magazine.

examples.definition: A daily or weekly publication on folded paper containing news articles and advertisements.
examples.example: I read the news in the newspaper this morning.

examples.definition: A type of newspaper with small pages, many photos, and articles of a less serious nature.
examples.example: I don’t always believe what I read in the tabloids.

examples.definition: The first page or cover of a newspaper; front-page news is of great importance.
examples.example: The story was on the front page of every newspaper.

examples.definition: The large text at the top of an article summarising its main point.
examples.example: Many people only read the headlines, so they are not really informed.

examples.definition: A piece of writing on a particular topic, published in a magazine or newspaper.
examples.example: I read an interesting article on elephants.

examples.definition: An informal piece of writing published regularly on a blog.
examples.example: Tom writes a new blog post for his blog every week.

sections.heading: Television and Radio
sections.content: Vocabulary for talking about broadcasting and related content.

examples.definition: To send out radio or TV content; also used as a noun for the content itself.
examples.example: The World Cup final will be broadcast live on several sports channels this Sunday.

examples.definition: A television station and the shows it broadcasts.
examples.example: They show a lot of good shows on that TV channel.

examples.definition: A network that produces and broadcasts radio programmes.
examples.example: I listen to my favourite radio station while I drive to work.

examples.definition: A show broadcast on television or radio.
examples.example: I watched an interesting programme on television last night.

examples.definition: A message in print, online, on TV, or on a poster promoting a product, event, or job.
examples.example: I saw an advertisement in the paper for a second-hand bicycle.

examples.definition: The American term for an advertisement broadcast on television or radio.
examples.example: The problem with that channel is that there are too many commercials.

sections.heading: People in the Media
sections.content: Key vocabulary for describing roles in journalism and broadcasting.

examples.definition: A collective term for journalists, photographers, and others who work in the media.
examples.example: After the incident the press was all over the place.

examples.definition: A person who researches, writes, and reports news through various media platforms.
examples.example: That journalist writes an article in the local newspaper every week.

examples.definition: A person who listens to radio programmes.
examples.example: The number of listeners has increased since the station hired a new presenter.

examples.definition: A person who watches television content.
examples.example: It’s a popular show with over 30 million viewers.

examples.definition: The group of people who watch or listen to a programme.
examples.example: We have an important message for our audience.

examples.definition: Photographers who follow famous people to take photos of them.
examples.example: The paparazzi were waiting outside the actor’s house.

examples.definition: Someone who films programmes, ads, or reports for television or cinema.
examples.example: The cameraman told me to act natural.

examples.definition: A person who presents a programme on radio or television.
examples.example: That man is a presenter on the 5 o’clock news.

examples.definition: A type of presenter who talks to guests on a programme.
examples.example: The host welcomed the two guests to the show.

examples.definition: Someone who collects and reports news for radio or television.
examples.example: The reporter was speaking live from the site of the disaster.

examples.definition: A reporter who collects and delivers sports news.
examples.example: As a sports reporter, Sam attends a lot of football matches.

examples.definition: A reporter who informs the public about predicted weather.
examples.example: The weather reporter said that it would be sunny all weekend.
